question:
Consider the following projects with countries where they are located:
  1. MBIR Project - Russia
  2. BELLE project - Japan
  3. ITER project - France
Which of the above is/are correct?
explanation: MBIR project is an initiative of Russia, and is coming up at the International Research Center in Dimitrovgrad, located in the Ulyanovsk region. The project aims at creation of a new technological platform for nuclear energy, which will be based on the closed fuel cycle with fast neutron reactors. BELLE Project aims to study the decay of the short-lived B-mesons. At Belle-II, highly intense electron-positron beams will be made to collide and a huge number of B-mesons (a boson containing the B, or beauty, quark) produced. ITER aims to build the world's largest tokamak, a magnetic fusion device that has been designed to prove the feasibility of fusion as a large-scale and carbon-free source of energy based on the same principle that powers our Sun and stars. It is located in France.
